lines.text: [first lines]
I don't know what the younger generation is comin' to. I never thought I'd see the day when a Stanhope lady, my own granddaughter, would go traipsin' off up North do a thing like this.
My own granddaughter in a-a - what do you call it - a rodeo. It's unladylike. It's worse than that. It's downright Northern!
If I could just win enough money to pay our debts. At least our taxes...
Debts! Taxes! There wouldn't be any if the South had won the war!
Yes, Grandpop, but they didn't.
[Billy is playing his harmonica]
Quit that squalkin', Billy!
Yessir, Colonel. I was just keepin' my mouth warm.
Can I borrow a buck? I'll pay it back out of your winnin's.
What if I don't win?
Well, you'll be broke anyhow.
Say, can you tell where an old muskrat names Stanhope lives?
Just follow this road - go that way, this way, that way and that's it.
That's it... You're a pretty smart girl. What's your name?
Stanhope.
Well, we... With my luck I mighta known that.
You have to excuse us, Miss. You see, we have a knack for getting' in wrong with Stanhope women.
[Gene's car stalls leaving the Stanhope plantation]
See how we're fixed for gas.
Plumb full - see. Hey, that don't smell like gasoline! That ain't gasoline - that's water!
Water?
Plain old H2O. We've been framed!
A fine way to treat our guests.
Well, I only wanted them to be guests a little longer.
I hope Barrelena's going to like it out there.
I think you'd like it out there, too, Caroline.
Well, I think I'd better wait to hear from the horse.
[last lines]
[Frog flees from Evangeline's proposal of matrimony]
Just wing him, Pa!
[Colonel Jefferson shoots Frog in the seat of his pants]
It's the same old South.
